description:
Senior Research Scientist (Applied Research)

Who we are:

We’re helping people get the most out of their supply chain models! We’re on a mission to help people and organizations tackle complex problems and take their models further.

Who we’re looking for:

A self-starter with a keen interest in emerging technology, searches for creative approaches to solving problems, and is dedicated to delivering high-value solutions to our customers. This is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing company at the forefront of web-based optimization empowering our customers to build and deploy models globally. Be part of a team pioneering the development of this new technology, enabling business users to collaboratively unlock and realize tremendous value. This is an opportunity for someone eager to “make their mark” on a world class product from the outset!

What you’ll do:
• Work on the Applied Research team to find solutions to complex modeling scenarios, and to properly document modeling approaches and results in our cloud framework (Atlas)
• Work with the team to build tailored apps that incorporate advanced solving technologies like
• optimization, machine learning, and discrete event simulation that will be used in a variety of ways.
• Resolve sophisticated issues around application performance, reliability,
• scalability, security, and data integrity.
• Work directly with clients to learn their critical performance indicators and look for optimization or simulation solutions to drive performance improvement.
• Creatively analyze model structure, inputs and outputs, and results to identify problems and opportunities, working with clients to realize improvement potential.
• Uncover and pursue solutions that improve project quality, timing, cost, or results.
• Validate and improve data structures, build and models and follow-up scenarios, and work with the team to prepare client presentations.
• Help create and execute project plans and successful modeling strategies, working with a team of experienced project managers and account specialists to deliver results.
• Work with a team of highly qualified experts, solving diverse and fascinating problems combining operations research, statistics, and simulation
• Work with Fortune 500 companies and consulting partners on high-value, high-visibility projects
• Make real contributions to solving mission-critical and globally impactful problems.
• Design and maintain code architecture and coding best practices for core technology.
• Coach junior team members through projects – help with initial scope, build code scaffolding, answer questions, and ensure that thorough testing is done.
• Advocate for high standards in QA (streamline process, expand scope of testing with unit tests and/or integration tests)
• Act as subject matter expert for core technology within the company
• visibility
• Influence roadmap creation and prioritization for core technology.
• Expand area of influence to several technologies and help manage dependencies, reduce redundant code, and spread best practices across teams.

Qualifications:
• Master’s / Ph.D. in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
• 5+ years of experience in a related position
• Ability to implement decision making models and tools through the use of modeling languages (e.g. Python, R) or more traditional languages (Java, C#..)
• Good communication skills with both technical and business audience
• Experience with relational databases (Postgres)
• Ability to work through different ideas, breaking down requirements for
• delivering software frequently
• Communication of what to build and ability to work with other developers
• Ability to review code and assist teams in improving code quality

About Optilogic:

Optilogic offers cloud-native supply chain network design solutions that enable businesses to evaluate trade-offs across financial performance, service levels, and systemic risk to design resilient supply chains even in the most dynamic, challenging environments. Its Cosmic Frog supply chain design solution tackles enterprise data at scale, runs models faster than ever, automatically converts legacy models, and requires no IT footprint. Cosmic Frog is the only supply chain design platform to combine optimization, simulation, and risk engines, and includes a risk rating on every scenario. Solutions include network design, intelligent greenfield analysis and site selection, M&A analysis, near-shoring/reshoring, CapEx planning, cost-to-serve, product flow, and many more. Stay in touch with Optilogic on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube and visit

About Cosmic Frog:

Optilogic Cosmic Frog is a 100% SaaS-based supply chain design solution and the first in the industry to enable companies to evaluate cost, service, and risk for more resilient supply chains. Cosmic Frog tackles enterprise data at scale, runs models faster than ever, automatically converts legacy models, and requires no IT footprint. The only supply chain design platform to combine optimization, simulation, and risk engines, Cosmic Frog includes a risk rating on every scenario. Use Cosmic Frog to answer supply chain what-if questions around network design, greenfield analysis, inventory strategy, M&A analysis, near-shoring/re-shoring, CapEx planning, cost-to-serve, product flow, and many more.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team. Optilogic is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
